ygData.msgSnippet: Gangon looked down and found BrightBlade issing....he fell to the ground and looked around...he looked into the lake and there she was.....so he ran and jumped

Gangon looked down and found BrightBlade issing....he fell to the ground and
looked around...he looked into the lake and there she was.....so he ran and
jumped into the lake.....he already didn't like it... "uh, it's a bit
cold..." he said.....he looked over on the other side of the lake..Sinister
was swimming around looking to make sure there were no Maximals in the
water.... "yup, he's a kook!..." Gangon said.....
----- Original Message -----
From: "Moon Mist" <shadowwarrior_ax@...>
To: <nbwrpg@egroups.com>
Sent: Friday, May 19, 2000 3:08 AM
Subject: Re: Neo Beast Wars


>
>
> * BrightBlade looked up at Gangon as he hung from the tree(or so I hope,
> Code forgot to post the name with the message so I'm taking a wild
guess.),
> she had to twist her head slightly to get some what of a straight view of
> him.
> She then shook her head then went back to leaning against the tree, she
> looked at the grapes but then pushed them aside.*
>
> " Whatever."
>
> * BrightBlade was beginning to get board, with Gangon doing absolutely
> nothing that interested her and herself just sitting there it was a bit
> obvious.
> She looked off in the distance but then thought that she had better move
and
> do something before she turned into a bump on a log, she got to her feet
and
> brushed herself off.
> Slag! She was dirty!
> BrightBlade scanned around and suddenly located just what she needed, a
> fresh water creek! She smiled to herself and then began to move slowly
away
> from the tree and Gangon, she was in much need of a bath!
> The creek wasn't to far away from the tree in which Gangon hung, in the
same
> clearing and in clear sight of each spot.
> She stuck a foot in and then pulled it back, it was COLD!
> BrightBlade then thought about how dirty she felt and just plain waded in,
> she clenched her teeth as she wadded in to about waist height.
> It was a good time to be thankful that her circuits were waterproof!*
>
>
>
